categories.name: Frogs
categories.description: Frogs in various sizes and colours from all around the world.

categories.name: Toads
categories.description: Toads from different parts of the world.

categories.name: Salamanders
categories.description: Salamanders for the water focused environments.

products.name: Amazon milk frog
products.description: The amazon milk frog is a bigger species (around 10cm in length) with stripes and blue blood!!

products.name: Common spadefoot toad
products.description: The common spadefoot toad also known as the garlic toad is a type of frog, not toad.

products.name: Axolotl
products.description: The famous axolotl, a specie with the ability to regrow its body parts :o

products.name: Poison dart frog
products.description: Don't let the poison in the poison dart frog's name fool you! It's perfectly safe to handle in captivity as long as you don't feed the wrong critters

products.name: Australian green tree frog
products.description: The australian green tree frog is the perfect beginner frog. Easy to take care of.

products.name: Chinese giant salamander
products.description: The chinese giant salamander is one of the largest salamanders in the world reaching 1.8m in length!

products.name: Common surinam toad
products.description: This species of toad, the surinam toad lives exclusively in a aquatic environment. They also have an unique ability to become flat as a pancake!

products.name: Smooth-sided toad
products.description: A smooth-sided toad is a beautiful brown toad with a dark brown stripe on their side.

products.name: Olm
products.description: The olm is a salamander that lives in the european caves. Their environment has given them a unique slender appearance.

products.name: Fire balled toad
products.description: The fire balled toad has a colorful pattern unlike most toad species.

products.name: Suwannee cooter
products.description: Suwanne cooter is native to Florida and has striking yellow stripes.

products.name: Indian flapshell turtle
products.description: The Indian flapshell turtle has nostrils with a similar appearance to a pig.

products.name: South American snapping turtle
products.description: Like their name, snapping turtles has fast reflexes and powerful beak.

products.name: Zarudny's worm lizard
products.description: A worm lizard from the Arabian peninsula with a love for sandy enviroments.

products.name: Red worm lizard
products.description: One of the bigger specie of worm lizards reaching lengths of 80 cm.

products.name: Bipes
products.description: Bipes or Mexican worm lizard has small forearms with five toes.

comments.comment: Unique looking salamander with it's long face. It's like a salamander, but slender.
I accidentally fed the frogs poisons critters...
I don't think I'll make it. I touched the frog and ingested the poison.
It lives up to its' garlic title. Somehow I was threatening and now the whole room smells like garlic.
IT HAS NO LEGS, NO ARMS WHAT AM I GOING TO DO!!
Why does it look like that. The face is literally .____.
It is the flattest toad I've ever seen, looks like a leaf.
The amazon milk frog confused my finger as food, I could feel everything.
One of the sweetest frogs, they love to just hang around <3
